intro: Hypoxis tetramera, commonly known as the four-leaf hypoxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense clusters.
